intro: Lachenalia camii, commonly known as the Cape Town lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces a basal rosette of fleshy, linear leaves that store water, aiding in its survival in dry environments. Lachenalia camii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is popular among succulent enthusiasts.
